intro: Catesbaea parvifolia, commonly known as the dwarf sugar apple, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant produces small, round fruits with a yellowish skin and a sweet, aromatic pulp containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and culinary purposes.
